subject: Re: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?
msgSnippet: Let s not make junit be the compiler too. Let the compiler catch syntax errors. JUnit will give you run-time errors and test failures.
messageBody:
Let's not make junit be the compiler too.
Let the compiler catch syntax errors.
JUnit will give you run-time errors and test failures.

Patrick McGovern wrote:

> would the fact that it won't compile be the answer?
> --- "STRAYER, JON (AIT)" <jon.strayer@...> wrote:
> > What could go wrong with this getter that is worth a
> > test?
> >
> > >
> > > class A {
> > > private int i;
> > > getI(){
> > > return i;
> > > }
> > > }
> > >
> > > I want test the geter,should i make testcase as a
> > inner class?
> >
>
